main event: A pilot observed a silver-colored object with blinking lights over Cutoff, Louisiana, on December 6, 1955.
interesting points: The object was reported to be not moving for two minutes while directly overhead., The pilot estimated the object rose about 1600 feet and was not the moon., The pilot chased the object for fifty miles but ultimately lost sight of it., The conclusion was that it may have been a balloon., The sighting lasted a total of approximately 15 minutes, including the chase.
witness description: The witness is a pilot and an ex-Marine with a good reliability rating.
